titles.en: Chapter 16 – Wearing the clothing of the Kabah
Chapter 16 – Wearing the clothing of the Kabah

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَمَّا يَصِلُ إِلَيْنَا مِنْ ثِيَابِ الْكَعْبَةِ هَلْ يَصْلُحُ لَنَا أَنْ نَلْبَسَ شَيْئاً مِنْهَا قَالَ يَصْلُحُ لِلصِّبْيَانِ وَ الْمَصَاحِفِ وَ الْمِخَدَّةِ تَبْتَغِي بِذَلِكَ الْبَرَكَةَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Abdul Malik Bin Utba who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about that which is brought from the cloth of the Kabah, is it correct for us that we wear something from it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is correct for the children, and the Parchments (covering the Holy Quran), and the pillowcase, seeking the Blessings by that, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Willing’.
